pullRequest.title: [DOC] remove replicated install content from using guide
pullRequest.bodyText:
Signed-off-by: prmellor pmellor@redhat.com
Documentation
The Using Strimzi guide has been updated so that the content present in the Deploying Strimzi guide is not replicated.

Getting Started assembly removed (assemblies/assembly-getting-started.adoc)
Cross-reference links updated to point to Deploying Strimzi guide instead of (removed) Getting Started section.
Overview updated to describe contents of guide and link to Deploying Strimzi guide for deployment instructions
Deploying Strimzi guide updated with Kubernetes version statements (no longer in Using Strimzi guide)

Checklist
Please go through this checklist and make sure all applicable tasks have been done

 Write tests
 Make sure all tests pass
 Update documentation
 Check RBAC rights for Kubernetes / OpenShift roles
 Try your changes from Pod inside your Kubernetes and OpenShift cluster, not just locally
 Reference relevant issue(s) and close them after merging
 Update CHANGELOG.md

nodes.bodyText:
Please can I check my understanding.
When using the {BookURLDeploying} attribute or the other {Book} attributes, it is necessary to use link instead of xref and to specify the module name in the square brackets. The caret symbol opens the link in a new tab. Is that right?
Does Asciidoctor complain if this advice is not followed?
We should update the documentation contributors guide with information on linking between the different guides that make up the Strimzi documentation.
